name: halo shawl
notes:
introducing halo shawl. it is a versatile fun pattern, written for dk weight yarn. less than 500m of yarn will make this cosy warm shawl to wrap around your neck. beginner friendly design, using basic stitches. a quick make, perfect for gifting!

includes a video tutorial

you can also use any weight yarn in your stash, just use the hook size that suits your tension. the pattern is very versatile and suitable for a beginner. only basic stitches are used in this pattern.

76in (cm) length x 29in (cm) depth

**materials**
audine wools by knitcrate, 50% alpaca/30% merino/20% nylon, 100g/215m/236yds
2 skeins in blush
5mm crochet hook (or size that fits your tension)

shawl is a triangle creating a wing span with a width of approx. 76‚Äù the main body is worked in one piece from bottom-up, increasing on each side until a shallow wide triangle is made.   
the shawl can be made larger or smaller by working more or fewer   pattern repeats. 
you can use any weight yarn and matching hook 
includes written instructions. 
pattern written in us and uk crochet terms 

pattern is available for free on my blog http://www.anniedesigncrochet.com/2019/01/17/halo-shawl-free-crochet-shawl-pattern/
